revised_title: Observation of a Luminous Streak in the Heavens
tldr: Captain John Grover, F.R.S., observed a luminous streak in the sky near Pisa on March 17th, 1843. He concluded that it was the tail of a comet, visible near the constellation Orion. The streak was about 40 minutes wide and extended to the stars Eridani and Leporis.
